image.altText: A close-up of a man with white hair and glasses looking directly into the camera with a wall behind him

props.synopsis: A man who had "formal" and "informal" arrangements with South Australia's Department for Child Protection to house First Nations children has pleaded not guilty to more than 40 charges including sexual offending against minors.

title.children: Man who worked with SA's child protection department pleads not guilty to child sex offences

image.altText: John Griffin

props.synopsis: John Edward Tilly Griffin has been jailed for more than nine years for the manslaughter of Gary Robinson at Port Neill in September 2023, in which Mr Robinson was left covered in shampoo, sprinkles and birdseed.

title.children: Killer inflicted 'blows of considerable force' before throwing sprinkles on victim

image.altText: Pigs in a pen.

props.synopsis: About 270 people will lose their jobs and multiple communities will be impacted with the pending closure of a rural South Australian pork processing plant.

title.children: Pork abattoir closure rubs 'salt in injury' for drought-hit towns

image.altText: A purple sign reads Vinarchy, Redefining Wine. It is surrounded by two yellow tanks.

props.synopsis: A global wine giant will close two well-known cellar doors in South Australia's key wine regions, creating uncertainty for staff.

title.children: Wine giant's shock closure of Banrock Station end of a 'fantastic marriage'

image.altText: A man in a high-visibility shirt with his arm around his teenage son, who is also wearing a high-visibility shirt

props.synopsis: Businesses are feeling flow-on impacts and cutting jobs after Whyalla's steelworks went into administration.

title.children: Job losses flow down the line from troubled SA steelworks

image.altText: A woman squats next to a lagoon with a small crab in her hand

props.synopsis: Wild storms push an algal bloom off SA's coast into the Coorong's lagoons, leaving the water "as thick as pea soup" and alarming fishers.

title.children: Dead and dying creatures found in 'pungent' dark water in SA's Coorong

image.altText: Katrine hildyard in a blazer speaking into microphones in front of a large painting

props.synopsis: The bill passed in the upper house during a late-night sitting on Tuesday, after securing enough support from the state's crossbench.

title.children: New SA child protection laws pass but advocates say reforms don't go far enough

image.altText: A close

props.synopsis: Four years after fleeing Hong Kong, outspoken pro-democracy advocate Ted Hui continues to be the target of an intimidation campaign, which the SA Law Society has denounced.

title.children: Pro-democracy activist targeted in 'deeply concerning' intimidation campaign

image.altText: A thumbnail showing the moment tracer shots are fired outside the GHF aid centre

props.synopsis: Early Sunday morning, Palestinians desperate for aid were killed while approaching an aid distribution site. ABC NEWS Verify analysed security footage, satellite imagery, and videos from the ground to try and paint a clearer picture.

title.children: What we know about Sunday's deadly incident near aid centre in Gaza

image.altText: Dry, cracked ground on a farm.

props.synopsis: There are multiple signs a boost in rainfall this winter and spring will alleviate the record drought currently crippling southern Australia.

title.children: Hope on the horizon — five reasons the drought will ease this year

image.altText: A woman with long brunette hair smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Prema Osborne left the Metropolitan Fire Service last week just weeks after the SA Employment Tribunal found travel payments to firefighters were unlawfully withheld and were "a failure of management diligence".

title.children: SA fire service's top executive leaves after damning tribunal decision

image.altText: A farmer in a blue shirt and cap stands beside the back of his ute, flanked by a kelpie dog on each side

props.synopsis: As South Australian farmers continue to battle keeping businesses afloat during the ongoing drought, many are calling for interest rate relief for loans so they can feed animals and cover essentials.

title.children: Farmers battling drought call for low-interest loans 'not a handout'

image.altText: A woman in a white shirt is photographed outdoors with soft sunlight and greenery in the background.

props.synopsis: SA fashion entrepreneur Carol Foord turned to alternative treatments before her death. A year on her family is still seeking answers about how her final hours played out.

title.children: An Adelaide fashion icon died after using magic mushrooms. Her family wants answers

image.altText: A hand holds an Aboriginal flag in front of a large banner

props.synopsis: South Australia's Aboriginal Affairs Minister says treaties with First Nations communities will not be concluded before the next state election, as Aboriginal leaders urge the state government to restart negotiations.

title.children: SA First Nations leaders await new treaty talks — but the government is 'not keen to rush'

image.altText: Grant Stevens in police uniform and hat outside a building with revolving glass door

props.synopsis: SA Police has launched a commissioner's inquiry after a man became unresponsive while being arrested last week in Adelaide's east.

title.children: Inquiry called after man becomes unresponsive during attempted arrest

image.altText: a man in a black puffer jacket stands among knee-high desiccated crops

props.synopsis: With this year's winter grain crop planted, ABARES estimates drought and dry conditions in SA, Victoria and NSW will see lower harvest totals this summer.

title.children: Drought delivers 8 per cent cut to grain production estimates

image.altText: A man looks at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Australian stocks opened higher after Wall Street gained. Economic growth slowed more than forecast in the first quarter of the year.

title.children: ASX maintains gains as GDP misses forecasts — as it happened

image.altText: Signage at a Telstra store in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The telco giant has paid a penalty and agreed to launch an independent review after it mistakenly disabled its connection to an emergency call relay service used by people with hearing or speech impairments.

title.children: Telstra fined after mistakenly disconnecting emergency call service

image.altText: An explosion coming from underwater with black smoke rising by  a bridge structure.

props.synopsis: Ukraine uses 1,100 kilograms of underwater explosives to attack the Kerch Bridge, which is a key supply route for Russian forces in Ukraine.

title.children: Ukraine hits bridge linking Russia and Crimea with underwater explosives

image.altText: Elon Musk wears a black baseball cap that says 'DOGE'.

props.synopsis: The Tesla entrepreneur says the "pork-filled" legislation the US president refers to as the "big, beautiful bill" is "outrageous".

title.children: Musk calls Trump's massive tax cuts bill a 'disgusting abomination'

image.altText: A middle aged white woman on a hospital bed with a machine over her mouth helping her breathe

props.synopsis: After years of lobbying from patients, the first ever national lung cancer screening program will roll out next month for people who have a significant history of smoking.

title.children: Australia's deadliest cancer to get new screening program

image.altText: A home buyer looks at documents. In the foreground of the image is a model house and keys.

props.synopsis: ASIC has accused the now-defunct Westpac brand of breaching its obligations under credit laws and engaging in "widespread unlicensed conduct" between June 2019 and April 2023.

title.children: Westpac's defunct bank RAMS sued over allegations of 'liar loan' mortgage applications

image.altText: A girl with blue eyes and smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: Police say they are no longer conducting "physical searches" for the 17-year-old, but they are investigating several lines of enquiry.

title.children: Police suspend search for Pheobe Bishop after three weeks missing

image.altText: Pink and green the aurora australis at Razorback Lookout in Victoria

props.synopsis: We've been treated to some stunning aurora australis light displays over the past few days. But the solar cycle means that'll settle down soon.

title.children: Why the aurora australis boom we're enjoying won't last forever

image.altText: Dorinda Cox Anthony Albanese

props.synopsis: One of Dorinda Cox's former staff members says workplace complaints about the WA senator remain unresolved despite the prime minister's insistence they have been addressed.

title.children: PM's comment about Dorinda Cox complaints offends former staffer

image.altText: A woman with sort hair is composited behind two men wearing glasses

props.synopsis: A recent US report on an abortion pill which experts have called "misinformation", "not scientific" and "scaremongering" has been cited in NSW Parliament by no less than 11 MPs across the spectrum.

title.children: 'Completely worthless': Flawed abortion pill 'study' cited in parliament

image.altText: A composite picture of bananas and apples in a line with a picture of Tank Man.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of pages of secret documents leaked to the ABC provide a rare glimpse into how human censors and AI erase references to Beijing's violent crackdown on pro-democracy protesters in 1989.

title.children: Why a picture of 'one banana and four apples' could be censored in China

image.altText: Jamarra Ugle-Hagan with the ball against the Demons in 2024.

props.synopsis: Western Bulldogs coach Luke Beveridge is unfazed about a media report linking Jamarra Ugle-Hagan with a move to the Sydney Swans next season.

title.children: Beveridge weighs in on Ugle-Hagan speculation

image.altText: Two white parrots with yellow crests stand on a waist-high fence waiting for another to stop drinking from a fountain.

props.synopsis: The behaviour has spread among a mob of more than 100 sulphur-crested cockatoos that roost in the Western Sydney Parklands.

title.children: Clever cockies not only open bins, they can use water fountains too

image.altText: A man with greying hair and a large bandage over his right ear emotionless in a police mugshot

props.synopsis: Federal agents are investigating "to what extent" Mohamed Sabry Soliman's family knew about the attack, and if they provided any support.

title.children: Colorado fire-bomb suspect's family being held for deportation

image.altText: Two orange e-scooters in the Perth CBD on a footpath.

props.synopsis: The death of a Perth father who was hit by an e-scooter in the city's CBD on the weekend prompts calls for an overhaul of Western Australia's e-rideable laws, including a proposed footpath ban.

title.children: 'The whole thing is upside down': E-scooter rules slammed after man's death

image.altText: Ed Husic gestures while speaking in front of microphones.

props.synopsis: In the wake of a huge victory few saw coming, Labor's enormous majority comes with a downside for the prime minister.

title.children: Labor's big numbers leave enough room for defectors and disagreements

image.altText: A man and woman wearing a mask, sitting on a park bench with distance between them

props.synopsis: What has changed since the pandemic when it comes to isolating when sick, whether it's COVID or a bad cold?

title.children: Should you still isolate when you are sick with COVID or influenza?

image.altText: A young woman with blond hair and glasses looks at the camera

props.synopsis: Fwends is a uniquely Australian story that follows two 20-somethings who travel interstate to revive their long-distance friendship.

title.children: This Aussie film about female friendship is taking the world by storm
